text: Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupeÅ‚niania profilu na ratebeer. HFD #20 Lekko sÅ‚odkie, mega pijalne, bardzo fajne cytruski i kwiatowy aromat. Lekkie, smaczniutkie, mega przyswajalne.

May 12, 2016. On tap at Hill Farmstead day at Warpigs. .
Hazy yellow with a small creamy white head. Aroma is hoppy with pine, grass, orange, grapefruit and hints of grain. Taste is light sweet, light to medium grassy and piney bitter. Light to medium bodied, smooth texture, soft to average carbonation. Crisp finish with a light and smooth piney and grassy bitterness, light fruity sweetness. 
Another juicy and drinkable pale ale from HF.
From tap. Hazy yellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, citrus, peach, fruit, hops and bitterness.
Ein extrem satt hefiges und zutiefst fruchtiges SIPA, mit einer styleungewÃ¶hnlichen, fast saftig anmutenden Textur. Die Grapefruitbombe. Spitze!!! 0,2/40 DKK vom Hahn in der MIKKELLER BAR Aarhus.
Tap takeover at Anchorage: poured a hazy orange with white head. The hops are amazing in the nose. Taste is awesome juicy hops.

Poured into a sample glass at the brewery: Pours straw with a decent white head. Aroma of citrus, cracker malts, light resin. Taste is more of the same. Tons of flavor for a session beer. Light and crispy, super tasty.
Sample @ Hill Farmstead Tap Takeover, Warpigs. Cloudy yellow body with a small white head. Bread, grainy notes, light hoppy, pine, citrus notes. Nice.

On tap at Prohibition Pig.
They poured this into a tulip.
The appearance was a glossy burnt yellow to hazy blonde color. Messy sticky lacing around the sides of the glass.
The aroma takes on sweet grassy sticky hops with a nice underlying bitterness all about. Citrus rind. Then a nice crisp sweet malt.
The flavor brings it all together bittersweet. Nice underlying bittersweet citrus rind. Sly grassy to citrus sweet aftertaste with a crisp bittersweet finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light on the body with a nice sessionability about it. Carbonation rides low enough.
Overall, really nice blonde ale, thatÂ’s what I thought it was. IÂ’d come back to.

Draught @ [ Hill Farmsted Tape Take Over ] - Warpigs Brewpub, Flaesketorvet 24, DK-1711 Copenhagen, Denmark. [ As Hill Farmstead Walden ].Unclear matt medium to yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, light fresh grain - bread, moderate to heavy hoppy, flowers, herbs, citrus, floral. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, floral, herbs, yeast, fruity, citrus - peach. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20160512]

Draft @ Warpigs Brewpub, Copenhagen. Pours a hazy yellow golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity citrus hoppy aroma. Fruity malty citrus hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty citrus hoppy weak peachy finish.
Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Aarhus. Light hazy golden pour with a frothy head. Tons of juicy hops, tangerine, light grapefruit, some biscuits and light floral notes.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar.
Hazy golden colored with a medium sized white head.
Fruity aroma of citrus, pine needles and hops.
Fruity flavor of hops and citrus with notes of pine needles.
Hoppy finish.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar Aarhus. Pours hazy yellow with a medium white head. Aroma is pretty dull at first. Pale malts, citrus, floral. As it opens up thereÂ’s a lot of tropical fruitiness coming through. Peachy, pineapple, papaya. Taste is juicy hoppy, pale malty, citrussy, floral, stone fruits.

(on tap @ Mikkeller) Poured at fridge temperature into a stemmed burgundy glass reveals a cloudy golden head with two fingers of white head that fades a little yet leaves beautiful lace. Aroma has subdued notes of citrusy hops with some floral undertones. Nice but nothing earthshattering. The texture is mostly oily but a little watery, carbonation is soft to medium, the body is light and the finish is short and crisp. Flavour is citrus and mostly hop juice but in a very drinkable way and the bitterness never gets in the way of the sessionability of this beer.
On tap it pours a light golden color with a nice head. Aroma of citrus, hops and lemon zest. The taste has some citrus bite, pine needles and some resin. Full flavor with a refreshing finish.

Keg. Hazy/unclear yellow, medium sized white head. Lots of citrus, pine, flowers. Light hay and bread. Some tropical fruits later, peach, apricot, melon. Low sweetness and not too bitter. Long fruity finish. Very easy drinking.

[5/12/16] Draught at Warpigs in Copenhagen. Cloudy yellow. Aroma of fruity hops, some onion. Dry flavor with nice moderately bitter fruity hops, a bit oniony. Quite light-bodied. Very nice and refreshing.

Tap. Hazy, pale golden body with a small, lacing white head. Amoma of orange, apricot, piney notes and caramel. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and quite bitter. Light bodied, watery texture and soft carbonation. An excellent SIPA. ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ

Keg @ WarPigs. Pours hazy yellow with a frothy white head that leaves some sparse spotty trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is grassy with crackers, grapefruit juice, freshly cut grass, pine needles, minerals and lemon zest. Taste is bitter and grassy. Mouthfeel is soft, dry, tiny astringent and light bodied. Finish is bitter with grapefruit, grass and chives. Bit too simple with an almost all grass hop profile but also soft, balanced and very refreshing. WouldnÂ’t mind more complexity but considering the drinkability this is great.

Draught @ Hill Farmstead Day - Warpigs Brewpub, KÃ¸benhavn
Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, citrus, grape, pine needles and hint of tropical fruits. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long citrus, tropical and fruity finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of mango, pineapple, peach, fresh crispy hops and stone fruits in general. The taste is fresh, juicy and crisp with notes of citrus, sweet stone fruits and slight pine. Overall a dank, juicy and easy drinkable session IPA.

fra fad duft citrus lime appelsin frisk juice
smag: citrus lidt kant af vÃ¥dt korn og af grÃ¦s.

Tap @ Warpigs. Hazy golden with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, peach and tropical fruit. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, peach, tropical fruit, earthy, little sweet and medium bitter.

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2016 On draft at Proletariat. Excellent session IPA. A little citrusy sourness, grassy hops a fine floral aroma.  Fresh and delicious.  This has the right amount of everything - who wouldnÂ’t like this?  IÂ’ll go out on a limb a little and call it the best session IPA IÂ’ve ever tasted.  Hats off to HF.  This explains why people will drive for hours to a little place called Greensboro for some of their beers

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2016 750mL growler filled 4/29/16 and drunk 5/4/16.Thoroughly hazy, though not soupy, soft, peachy-gold body is topped by a white head showing strong retention.Very dry nose yields fresh, clean water and minerality, with light fruitiness very slowly building up from the hops. Amazingly, the simcoe add no pine/cherry and just a touch of juicy grapefruit. Amarillo add woodsy and softly citric character while motueka adds its very similar character (leafy, green, lightly vegetal, soft citrus and nectarine). Crackers and whitebread in the background stay out of the way of the hops which continue to crescendo with warming and breathing, eventually ending with juicy nectarine, peach and lemon, and a light smattering of honey.Incredibly dry (but with an ample, malty texture and tight carbonation) in the flavor with a bare cracker-like maltiness. Hops are incredibly well-controlled adding only modest bitterness and absolutely no resin. Hints of key lime and grapefruit rind are the extent, with plentiful yellow fruit and woody, leafy, vegetal (not spoiled vegetal, but a good vegetal. Like fresh, live, vibrant vegetation). Supremely delicate and phenomenally well-executed.Catches you off guard.  At first it seems a bit light (which it is) but then 10 minutes later IÂ’m saying, "Holy shit thatÂ’s good".

On tap outside at WarPigs Brewpub during Hill Farmstead Day, kindly shared by KimJohansen. Solid lacework from a diminishing white head. Pale golden body, cloudy. Mild aromas of freshly cut grass, citric hints. Mid-sweet flavours of bread, grass, and apricot. Mid-dry fruity bitter end, short lived. Easy to drink(Copenhagen 12.05.2016)

Aroma and taste is a mix of tropical and citrus fruits, medium pale malts, peachy with some grapefruit, satsuma and lemon fruity citrus, refreshing and highly enjoyable sipa.

Bottle @ Warpigs, Copenhagen. Pours slightly hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of light malt, grass, fruity hops, citrusly hops, light pine. Flavor is light bitter, malt, grassy, fruit, citrus. Medium body, average carbonation, dry and light bitter finish. 120516

Sample at Warpigs during Hill Farmstead Day 2016. Hazy golden beer with a nice offwhite head. Hoppy citrus and pine aroma, grassy, peach, floral notes. Hoppy citrus flavor, grassy, pine, caramel notes. Quite nice.
From Tap. Fast klare hell goldgelbe Farbe, geringe weiÃŸe Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr hopfig, grasig, blumig. Geschmack getreidig malzig, leicht hopfig, grasig.
On tap at Hill Farmstead. A light, refreshing blond ale that is definitely designed to be had on a hot summer day. Great aroma from the hops and a nice bitterness balance.

Draught @ Hill Farmstead Day, Warpigs, Copenhagen. Pours yellowish with a smooth head. Aroma of juicy fruits, fresh grassy hops, floral notes, citrus and tropical notes. Taste is refreshing, hoppy and fruity with some floral and tropical notes. Finish is crisp, hoppy and juicy fruity with some tropical notes. Pretty refreshing and tasty.
Tap at Warpigs, Copenhagen. Colour is very cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Fruits, citrus, grape, dryness, hops and malts.
Tap @Warpigs. Cloudy yellow, small white head. Light aroma, some lemon and malt. Flavour has sweetish lemon with a nice bitter bite.
On tap at Warpigs. Cloudy pale yellow with a small white head. Malty aroma with fresh grain and bread along with grass and hay. Dry grassy and grainy flavour
Tap warpigs. Pour s couldy golden with a white head. Aroma of citrus, light earthy, light yeast, light spice, juicy, light grainy. Taste is rather sweet, light bitter fruity. Not de la senne standard
Very nice light yellow coloured with a white head. Piney hoppiness to the nose. Quite easy drinking.

Tap @ Warpigs, tap take over. Hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, fruity and moderate hoppy - fruity and citrus. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 120516
Tap@ warpigs. Pale golden color with a thin white head. Malty aroma, some light fruits, hops, floral notes. Quite typical English golden ale really. Hoppy citrusy, floral flavors.

Draught. Yellow coloured. Unclear. Dense off white head. Aroma. Some herbs, citrus, grass. Flavour. Herbs, grass, spice. Medium bodied. Ends grassy bitter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

[emailÂ protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Golde hazy. Really dank weedy herby nose, malty slight .. sort of grainy, but in a soft niceish manner. Lightish bodied. Citrus, pale faded malts. Dryish hoppy finish. Once again, like the balance.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
From tap. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is grassy, straw and mild citrusy. Bitter, mild cornish. Straw. Grassy and crisp hoppy finish.
Pours milky golden with a low white head. Aromas of peach, mango, citrus, grass, pink grapefruit. Taste is fruity and floral with light bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.

Pours milky yellow with low white head 
Aromas hoppy of citrusy fruits , grass, hints of hay, pine
Taste has notes of mango, passion fruit, pineapple, grass, hints of lactose 
Mouthfeel is medium carbonation, low to medium body, crisp, low to medium bitterness

Draft at The Ginger Man, NYC. Straw color, hazy, white head. Aroma is fruity with citrus, peach, and pear. Taste is citrus, tropical fruit, white pepper, faint vegetal notes, spices, light pine and light malt. Refreshing.

750 ml swing top to pint from Hill Farmstead, filled 5/3 and enjoyed today (stamped best consumed by 5/11). Looks good for the style; a somewhat hazy lemony pineapple with foamy white head. Smells and tastes of fruity and bitter hops with a pleasantly bitter but clean medium light-bodied mouthfeel. Tasty and sessionable.

Tap at Hill Farmstead, 25cl, $4. Pours a cloudy straw/banana peel color with a white head. Aroma of juicy tropical hops. Taste is semi dry and not bitter at all. Mouthfeel truly crushes it for such a low ABV beer. Finish is quick and dry.
 #EmbraceTheHaze  
http://i.imgur.com/1BA8ErV.png

Growler fresh from the brewery. Pours a lightly hazy yellow with a small white head that clings to the glass quite nicely. Nose is a bit dank and grassy and peppery. Taste is pretty dry, moderately bitter. Some floury cereals along with piny and peppery hops. Body is light to medium and carbonation moderate. A nice light IPA, tasty and all.

750 mL growler. Unknown original review date.

Hazy with a white head. Yellow/orange body. Very wispy.

Smells of grapefruit hops, just like Life without Principle #1, but more of an earthy pine hop presence. Pale malt is also more prevalent, which is strange considering this should be less malty.

Taste is grapefruit hops and that same touch of earthy pine. More pale malts again than its other blonde cohort. Even a touch of bitterness to this one.

Light, more body and bitterness than Life without Principle #1, which I donÂ’t get. Not quite as easy to drink, though.

Good. Very nice for a blonde ale. Light in body but still has a good hop bite to it. Impressive as always.

Tap at Farmhouse Tap & Grill. It pours cloudy gold with a decent white head. The nose is soft, juicy, fragrant, tropical fruits, grass and cracker. The taste is crisp, bitter, clean, minerals, grassy, grapefruit rind, pithy lemon and pine with a dry finish. Light - medium body and fine, foamy carbonation. Crisp, clean and crushable. Not big and showy, just very well-made and sessionable.

750ml growler pours hazy pale yellow straw with 2 finger head. Nose is sarthy dank lemony grass, herbal, touch of dough. Taste is crisp, soft, light doughy malt with juicy lemon, citrus, tropical fruit, grass. Finishes dry, balanced bitterness, light cracker and dough with juicy tropical fruits. Awesome!

DÃ©gustÃ©e en fÃ»t chez Parker Pie. Ohhhhhh que cette biÃ¨re ricaneuse et Ã©clatante est facile Ã  boire! Le liquide est non filtrÃ© et bien voilÃ© sous une couche de mousse Ã©clatante et onctueuse formÃ©e de grosses bulles insistantes! CÂ’est court, frais, printanier et aÃ©rien. Aucun arriÃ¨re-goÃ»t, juste du bonheur! Du gros petit jus mon DS!
Draft. Yellow pour with white head. Citrus and grassy, some other fresh hop aromas. Nice light session ipa, grassy and citrus flavors.
On tap at the brewery. Cloudy yellow pour with a big white head. Citrusy/florally hop bouquet. Big taste for the low ABV. Florally hop notes dominate. Good body and mouthfeel.

Growler thanks to 50belair! Pours cloudy golden, medium creamy off-white head with great staying power and nice lacing. Aroma is rich dank grapefruit, passionfruit, pine. Flavor is not quite up to aroma, but still nice, quite light sweet, light bitter, juicy, not harsh. Light body, soft on the palate, a bit watery.

On tap at the brewery on 21. June 2014. Standing two hours in line. Big thank you to Russel for his patience and driving. Unclear pale orange in the glass, small foamy head. Sweet fruity at the nose. Starts with a lot of fruity sweetness, scratchy. Low bitterness. Too sweet in my opinion.

Growler thanks to Seth. Pours a cloudy yellow with small frothy white head. The aroma is strong pine, resin hop. Thin mouthfeel with nice light bitter hop, and a bit watery and easy to drink, very impressive.
Growler. Very nice pale ale. Not enough bitterness or aggressive use of hops to be an session ipa. It is more of just a pale ale. Delicate floral aroma, very balanced. Good stuff.

Quelques verres, de growlers. ArÃ´mes invitants de houblons amÃ©ricains (agrumes, rÃ©sine, touche vÃ©gÃ©tale). Robe blonde pÃ¢le et trouble, effervescence moyenne et lÃ©gÃ¨re dentelle. En bouche, les houblons trÃ¨s aromatiques (surtout agrumes, conifÃ¨res et rÃ©sine) sont appuyÃ©s par une base maltÃ©e svelte mais dÃ©veloppant de belles notes de cÃ©rÃ©ales. Finale trÃ¨s sÃ¨che et moyennement amÃ¨re. Essentiellement une version lÃ©gÃ¨re de Edward.

64oz growler. Hazy pale yellow with a fluffy white head. Flavors are bread, grapefruit, lemon zest, pine resin and honey with floral and grassy notes. Dry and lemony finish. Light body, soft to moderate carbonation, smooth texture.

2oz pour at the brewery. Pours a hazy light gold, with some thin white head. Nose packs a huge punch, bright chive and scallion and garlic scape, bright pine, perfume, herbs, grapefruit, lemon, floral, zesty. Very inviting. Flavor follows right along, big punchy citrus zest, bright onion patch, scallion, chive, scape, grapefruit zest, orange zest, even a little bit of lime, dried pine, only the faintest hint of sweetness to round things out. Dry, zesty finish. Incredible. Packs an incredible amount of flavors for a beer coming in at 4%.

Draft. Pours murky yellow with thin white head that lingers. Mild citrus aroma over light carbonation. Light session ipa with some complexity. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pour is a pale hazy yellow with a bubbly white head. Nose is balanced, bready and light dough with fresh grain notes. Hops are soapy and citrusy afterwards. Taste is strongly balanced leaning towards the grain and malt bill. Bread, fresh grain, balanced hop, faint soapy, balanced citrus hop, gentle bitterness. Carbonation is great, body is light and airy with a semi dry finish. Could be a bit brighter but darn this is drinkable and balanced. Wish I had a keg every Saturday to day drink for hours.

Pours a hazy straw color with some head and some lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is hop forward and citrusy with some juicy melon, & bright orange/orange-peel character. Really fresh and pungent, really nice smelling. 

The flavor is again very fruit forward, citrusy with plenty of melon. ItÂ’s got some fruit rind character and a nice light bitterness. Very bright, very hoppy... not especially complex but thatÂ’s made up for by itÂ’s brightness and charm. 

A real chill low boost & not a shelf beer at all.

Yellow grassy color. Crisp and very fresh sugar and candy aroma. Surprisingly light flavor, dry and a little sweet. Felt not flavorful enough at first but turned out to be a very rewarding and rich session beer. The balance is a bit off. Medium/full body with a grassy finish. Perfect for a sunny autumn day.

10/9/2013.On tap at the Farmhouse Tap & Grill in Burlington. Light amber color with a white head. Very hoppy aromas with pine and citrus. Fantastic balance and complexity and with a very hoppy finish. Awesome beer.

This one poured a yellow color with a white head. Aroma was lots of tropical fruits, some resin and peaches. Flavor was similar, very light grain, big popping tropical hops. Very flavorful for the abv.

Pours from a swingtop bottle a bright yellow-gold color with a thin white head that burns away steadily to an outer ring. Sparse rings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of citrus, hops and bready malt. Light-bodied with flavors of grassy hops, citrus and biscuit malt. The finish is mildly bitter with a lingering hoppy aftertaste. Well-executed low-ABV Pale all around.

On tap in Burlington... Hazy golden color, light white foam... nice aroma of citrus and tropical fruits, delicious if understated flavors of citrus, vanilla, and pine forest... Well balanced and delicious... Leaves you wanting more!

Sampled at the brewery. Pours hazy, golden with a lacy, white head. Aroma of citrusy and floral hops with a nice, light maltiness. Flavor the same. Average texture. A good beer but I was expecting a little more from these two breweriesÂ’ collaboration.

Growler poured a pale blonde color with sticky lacing and a white foamy head

smell of pine, light hops and tropical fruit.

flavor of citrus, piney and sticky hops. very light and well balanced session beer

Draft at brewery. Hazy gold, white head. Smells like a grassy meadow. Notes if citrus, mostly orange on the palate... Excellent session brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler shared by Dan. Great aroma of pine, blood orange and grass. Very light hop profile but crisp. Pours Hill Farmstead hazy with a light mineral head. Taste is pretty light with a good citrus and pine hop but no bitterness. The hop fades quickly to a light pale minerally malt. A nice pale ale, though a bit overrated.

Pour is hazy golden with white head and good lacing. Aroma of bright citrus, piney, floral. Taste is grapefruits, piney, light malt, very light sweetness and nice dry finish, low bitterness. Low body and good carb. Really nice pale ale. Refreshing and really drinkable. This growler went down too fast.

750ml bottle growler from brewery.
Appearance : Clear pale yellow with medium foamy white head.

Aroma : Clean and sharp floral hops. Slightly citrusy and slightly piny.

Taste : Floral hops with quite a lot of malt. Finsih is floral and malty.

Overall : Really nice beer. Quite drinkable. Really floral and quite malty too. Nice body for such a light beer. Love this kind of low alc hoppy beers.

750 ml bottle direct from the brewery. Pours a light hazy gold with a medium pillowy white head. Aromas are pine and grapefruit . Taste is citrus dominant (pineapple, grapefruit) but not overpowering and only mildly bitter. ThereÂ’s definitely a mildly sweet malty background that keeps this beer in the APA category rather than IPA. Light bodied, and a nice long but not cloying bitter finish. Great session beer.

Poured at HFS Farmhouse Fest. Pours a hazy yellow golden color with a finger of sticky foam. Lots on fresh grassy hop notes with round melon and a rustic wheat bread backbone. Smooth easy drinker a touch thin in the mid palate but overall a very sessionable flavorful beer.

First tasted at the brewery while waiting in line for growler fills, then shared less than 72 hrs after purchase with my lovely wife over a meal of pesto-prawn salad. Bright, translucent, lemony yellow with a sudsy white head that leaves heavy rings of lace down the glass. Aroma is freshness in a glass-- delicate fresh hops that display characteristics in equal proportion of both crisp, green grassy notes and ripe rind of citrus. Light, biscuit malts support a vibrant but delicate hoppy body, notes of carrot tops, kumquat, guava, and honeydew, leading to a crisp finish of just-right balancing bitterness. The hype is true; this is magical stuff.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Growler shared by GT. Cloudy light golden pour with a white head. Really floral and citrus forward aroma. Biscuit malt notes, some grass, and dough. Doughy, biscuity flavor. Nice body and malt character for such a low gravity beer. Big time floral hops, some citrus peel, pine, and grass. Light bitterness on the finish.

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2016 Hazy yellow pour. Aroma of grains amd lime. Lemonlime bitterness up front grassy, cereal, a bit buttery. Very sessionable.  Revisited 2016.  Wheat and citrus fruit prominent in aroma and taste.  No butter here whatsoever.  Ticked upwards accordingly.

Growler thanks to GT2! Cloudy bright yellow pour with thick white foam. Fresh Doughy, mildly buttery biscuit nose. Fruity tropical as well. Taste is doughy, lightly buttery, some hibiscus floral. Really soft and delicious.

750mL flip-top big thanks to Ed5388. Beautiful glowing peach pour with rocky, meringue foam. Nose is beautiful sweet cream butter (Hill Farmstead house yeast), soft butterscotch, peaches&cream ice cream, juicy cantaloupe, whipped cream. As it warms, a flash of exotic/pithy tropical melon comes through (Motueka I assume). Taste is juicy, rich butterscotch is a flavor but not a density. Floats on the tongue with mega buoyancy. Super soft bitterness is not the main character here- juicy hops and tropical fruit are 90% with the remaining a soft bitterness. Soft and refreshing rather than abusive. Slick, soft butteriness on the palate is exactly what I am after. A big improvement over tannic astringency or chemical soap. Exactly the APA I was hoping this would be and much more. A perfect hop combo of some of my favorites, especially Amarillo. Wow. This is the entire purpose of the APA style- delicacy, bright hoppiness, refreshing body unlike IPAs which are bitter for no reason and heavy in mouthfeel. This is the session beer we all should be demanding. I will be dreaming of this beer.

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2013 On tap @ The Farmhouse (Burlington VT). Pours a hazy pale yellow with a thin foamy white head. Aroma of pineapple, grapefruit, and citrus. Taste is light citrus and grapefruit, some pineapple, and some cracker. Almost tastes like a light version of S&S 5. Nice crisp and really refreshing!
Cloudy white gold with a finger white head. Yeasty grassy aroma. Light and easy drinking with just a touch of hop. Sessionable is an understatement. Wow!
juicy, crisp, citrus, slight pine. soft and floral aromas and flavors. very very pale. incontrovertibly an important beer for anyone serious about finely crafted pale ales.

$8 for the 16 ounces at Positive Pie, in the new Hardwick location. Pours a meringue golden with a trim, sudsy, snowy white head. Aromas of limeade, cilantro, oregano, wheat cereal, bone marrow, and pilsner malt. Tastes similar, but unquestionably better: itÂ’s of pine cones, fir leaves, American hops, russet potatoes, agave syrup, and seawater. Sweat and farmhouse yeast by swallow. Earthy and bittersweet. Likeable.

Glowing orange body, large white head, soapy lacing. Nose is light citrus, grass and grainy malt. Flavor is similar with grain becoming more predominant. Light bodied, a bit then in the middle, assertive hops, refreshing but a bit too light for the flavor profile.
Sample at the brewery on 7/6/13. Clear gold pour with a thick white head. Aroma of malt and grassy and piney hops. Very clean. Sweet malt flavor with grassy hop accents before a piney finish.
Growler at chopkofest pours gold with white head. An abundance of citrus mix in a touch of hay and earth. Body is slick.

Growler (750 ml). 2 days old! Huge thanks to Minderbinder for bringing me this beer! Hazy pale glowing yellow with a huge white head and intense lacing. Aroma of citrus (orange, tangerine), light pine, hops and floral notes. Taste is of citrus, mild piney hops, floral notes. Really hoppy, but only slightly bitter. Light body. Crisp. Good carbonation. Dry. This is a perfect summer beer. Great session ale. Tasty, citrusy, dry, extremely refreshing and Ã¼ber-drinkable. I want a keg of this... every day of the summer.

750 ml bottle from the brewery. Nice pale appearance with a cap of soapy head. Nose is very nice floral hops with clean pale malt. Taste is a vibrant array of hops and malt. Citrus, hay, cracker malt and light grassy hops. Light body with a dry texture. Finish is very clean and crisp. Perfectly balanced beer that I can drink all afternoon and into the evening. Damn Mr. Hill, that magic well water is working yet again! Excellent pale ale.

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2013 Draft at THE FESTIVAL 2013 in Maine with Andrew, Jay and Kramer. Pours a light golden body with nice white lacing. Aroma is soft citrus notes and light funk - definitely making the Simcoe and Amarillo "duet" apparent. Mouthfeel is super soft, light and fluffy - notes of funky citrus and very light pine. Very nice light American Pale ale - would be great to be able to session on this, but I will probably never see it again.

Hazy golden color with a medium sized, white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of Amarillo, citrus, orange, light pine, and some toasted malts. Taste of citrus, tropical fruits, light grass, pine, and juicy hop finish.

On tap. Incredibly strong aromas of citrus and grass and hops. Pours a bright cloudy amber. Very bitter aftertaste but light, not the best balance. Interesting and refreshing

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Where and how  Prohibition Pig 
Aroma medium intense. Soft aromatic feel, hint of pineapple fruit. Soft floral notes. 7+
 Appearance  
Top: medium white cap. Some lace shown. 3+
Base: hazy gold.
Palate :  soft, smooth easy going with delicate carbonation. Longer than average finish. Medium bodied with thinner walls. 
Taste: citrus hop profile with biscuit like malt feel. Note of vanilla, pineapple and soft herbal rose.

On tap at TJÂ’s. Hazy yellow brown with brief white froth. Nose is toffee, pine, orange and grapefruit. Medium body with crisp biting carb; super drinkable and refreshing. Taste is lemon lime, a little pine and honey with a lingering bready finish. Great pale.

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2013 On tap at TjÂ’s with Court, Bri, and Alan, pours hazy golden orange with light head, and not much lacing. Notes of lemon, citrus hops, well water, grapefruit, grass and clean malt. Good bit of the motueka came out as it warmed up a bit. Body is super juicy with crisp, bitter lemon hop finish. Awesome session ale but I prefered the double dry hopped spring fever in Vt to this. Just lacked enough flavor but what do you expect for a 4% beer.
TrÃ¨s citronnÃ© et sÃ¨che avec une prÃ©sence dÂ’amertume trÃ¨s discrÃ¨te, manque un peu de nuance au niveau des saveurs de houblons mais sinon, buvabilitÃ© excessive.

From notes. 2L growler straight from the source. Pours a semi-clear yellow with a healthy white head. Shared with my brother. Smells of citrus, pine, and hay, super clean. Taste follows with the citrus and resinous pine, and again super clean finish. Great summer blonde... hope this makes an appearance again in 2013.

On draft at Blackback.

Pours a light, hazed yellow with a dense white head.  Leaves plenty of lace and thing ring as the head fades.  Crisp bready malt and lemon/citrus hop aroma; nicely balanced.  Light bodied, well carbonated with a dry grassy and citrus bitter hop finish.  Flavor has a strong bready malt base and tons of lemon and grass, with mild grapefruit juiciness.  Amazing for a blonde.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2013 In short: A wicked hoppy-but-not-bitter aromatic low-abv blonde ale.  Fantastic thirst beer.
How: Tap at the brewery, then a full growler the day after, then another full growler the day after the day after.  I guess I loved that beer.
The look: Cloudy yellow topped by a small white head.
In long: The highly aromatic nose has pale garden glowers, fresh lemongrass, some bananas, grapefruits, more...  Tastes is a slice of freshly baked bread, a few slices of smooth not-yet-ripe yellow bananas, freshly cut lemongrass, some dough, citrus fruits, light piney notes and even a bit of a rustic thing going on.  Becomes more and more grassy (sun dried yellowed grass) the more I dink the beer with some tart grapefruits.  Bitterness level in the low-medium range and there is a light refreshing tartness.  Finish is rather dry and grassy.  Just as good as Lawsons Three Penny Especiale that was launched a few months before Walden and only a few miles away from Hill Farmstead and Alchemist, and these two are my now my two best low abv pale ales.  Summer was good in Vermont for low abv hoppy thirst beer lovers.  Another beer IÂ’d drink every day, I drink so much beer now that I am prescribed pills to help with my failing kidneys and it says Â“take with plenty of fluidsÂ” and Â“do not take with alcoholÂ” and I have no idea what to do.

On tap@ The Pig....Hazy honey colored pour,medium white head,good lacing.Aroma is earthy with notes of lemon and grapefruit.Smooth bitterness,grapefruit,grassy and a touch of resin. Light bodied but good hop flavor for the low abv which is hard to do.

Growler drank at the cabin, NH. Pours lightly cloudy gold with a fine, white foam head. Absolutely gorgeous aroma of cat pee, fresh grass, nips of zesty citrus. Light to medium sweet flavor, dry and zippy citrus, pithy citrus, orange, grapefruit, dry grass. Light bodied with fine to average carbonation. Moderately dry to finish, more pithy citrus, tangerine, grapefruit, light grassy hops, touches of lemon rind. Obscenely drinkable. The balance is perfect. ThereÂ’s some excellent hop kick. Unreal good. I donÂ’t know what else to say.

Growler shared by steve_o.  Pours hazy gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with good lacing.  Aroma is fragrant floral, grapefruit, and fruity hops, biscuit and meal malt, and tropical fruity esters.  Flavor is heavy hops, fruity esters, supporting malt and a dry finish.  Light body and medium carbonation.

Â“I am glad to have drunk water so long, for the same reason that I prefer the natural sky to an opium-eaterÂ’s heaven. I would fain keep sober always; and there are infinite degrees of drunkenness. I believe that water is the only drink for a wise man; wine is not so noble a liquor; and think of dashing the hopes of a morning with a cup of warm coffee, or of an evening with a dish of tea! Ah, how low I fall when I am tempted by them! . . . Of all ebriosity, who does not prefer to be intoxicated by the air he breathes?Â”
- Thoreau, Walden.

And yet. September 1, 2012.

Pours a cloudy canary yellow with one finger of white head. The bubbles accumulate in the middle of the glass, forming something like a small hill of elevated head.

Clean citrus sweetness, citrus pith, tropical fruit sweetness, faintly grassy, with some light biscuit malt character. Very aromatic, highlighting the lemony citrus.

Soft maltinessÂ—biscuity, wheatyÂ—with some of the same clean citrus found on the nose. Just a hint of earthy bitterness on the finish, but without any real bitter bite, thankfully. Juicy melon.

Medium, medium light in body, fantastically balanced APA. IÂ’d trade some green beans for it.
Excellent aroma. Pungent waves of citrus greet the nose.  The flavor is understated...  Was almost expecting this to be sweet given the aroma, but thatÂ’s OK. Nice bitter finish.  Thanks to Steve.

Bottle at DanÂ’s house. Pour is hazy lemon with a frothy one-finger white head. Big hoppy aroma, with hints of lemon zest, pine, sticky resin, weed, and grapefruit peel. Nice. Taste is sweet up front with a lot of hops in the middle; pine, grass, citrus, and tangerine, ending moderately bitter. Mouthfeel is light and high carbonation with a light ganja aftertaste. Really nice APA and some real amazing flavors for such a low ABV. Well-done.

Pour out of growler, thanks Steve! Nice hazy yellow orange pour with white head, aroma has notes of grass, pine, biscuit, some nice grapefruit, lemon, touch of pineapple, slight grass and floral notes.  Taste is a mix of lemon grass, some biscuit, bread, hints of pineapple, mango, some slight orange and grapefruit peel, finishing fairly bitter, drinkable, really nice beer.

UPDATED: JUL 20, 2013 Growler @ DanÂ’s house. Thanks Stephen! Hazy, whitish yellow appearance with a white head. A bit spicy, floral, herbal, light veggie, a touch fruity aroma. Slightly chewy, a bit dank, floral, grassy flavor. One of my least favorites from HF.

From a 1L swingtop growler. Walden pours a solid, light-hued yellow. Super hoppy on the nose and very inviting. Lots of pungent hops from lemon to grapefruit and pine. Thin mouth feel with medium to high carbonation. Light malt and blonde ale character on the nose and taste with a resiny hop character that lingers. Nice bitter finish, but some of the amazing complexity of the aroma doesnÂ’t translate to the taste. Still, a very enjoyable beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler shared with czar and minderbender. Hazy yellowish with a short-lasting white head. Smells like resin, hops and citrus. Very fruity taste, interesting cereals taste. Finish is all citrus, along with a touch of spice. Light bodied, resinous mouthfeel. Excellent pale ale.

Growler... Hazy light-golden ale with a small, creamy, white head. Decent retention. The bouquet is a medley of fruity, earthy, floral hops. Light to medium-bodied with dancing carbonation. The flavor is of lightly bitter, ultra-flavorful hops, a gentle kiss of acidity and virtually no sweetness. Finishes tangy with a diminutive splash of dry white wine. Growler courtesy of the always generous landhoney! SethÂ’s a player and this is a kick ass blonde ale. A tip of the cap to Shaun and John for knowing their way around a brewery.

growler, not as fresh as could be. blasts the nostrils with fresh hop citrus goodness. relatively light on the tongue given how potent the nose is. little pine, little lemon, little resin, little spring morning dewy. this baby dances on your tongue but something about it tells me it wonÂ’t stand out my in mind long term....a tasty treat for now, nonetheless.

From growler. Thx Czar.
Pours blond with medium white head. Alot of lacing. Aroma is of hops, citrus, pine. Taste is of hops, citrus, pine. Biter finish. Palate: fair body for the style. Overall: Very good. Interesting balance. Refreshing.

bottle shared with VT and minderbinder. pours hazy bright golden with a nice white head, good retention, some lacing. fresh citrus, light pine, strawberry-like, spicy malts, peppery-yeast. crisp and breadied malts, hint of sweetness. soft carbonation, light body - oily mouthfeel, very nice citrusy yet herbal finish. very nice session ale.

Poured from a growler thanks to starrdogg. Poured a really light golden yellow color with a fizzy look and a light white head. Some light malty character to it, some floral notes, and some grassy hop character. Flavor was light hops, with some malt character to it. Sessonable, but thatÂ’s about it.At the risk of sounding like a jerk and getting a lot of flack, and while I love many of the beers from HF, methinks that this beer might not have such a high rating if not for the brewery. Perhaps itÂ’s time for Shaun to secretly brew a few batches under a nom de plume brewery name and see if gets even half the praise some of these entries give.

Shared by starrdogg. Thanks Matt.

The beer is light golden yellow with a soft, white head. The aroma is great, offering some citrus and tropical fruits. The flavor brings a light, biscuit, malty character that gracefully balances the beer. Still a hop forward offering, of course. Lingering hop bitterness and tropical citrus on the palate. Delicious. I could drink a lot of this.

Growler shared by Deuane at the very end of Campground Brewdown.

A - Pours hazy pale yellow with a frothy one and a half finger tall white head leaving sticky lace down the entire glass.

S - Smells of pungent grassy hops, dulled tropical fruits, pine resin, touch of sweet pils malt with a light breadiness. The hops work well with the base.

T - Starts off with some bready pils malt quickly giving way to hints of citric zest, resin and a surprisingly low amount of grassy hop bitterness. There is still plenty of hops in it but they are nicely subdued, allowing this one to be incredibly drinkable.

M - Medium-Light body with moderate carbonation. Subtle chewiness with plenty of hop bitterness, nearly balanced to perfection.

O - This one tastes like some of the other HF pale ales, even tho it is a blonde ale. The hops and base blonde work very well together, combining with the low ABV to make this one very easy to consume. This is a really awesome beer.
My beer should be this beer.  Light bitterness and a huge hop presence, with some nice vaguely honey-esque malt.  Amazing, especially given the ABV.

Growler. Pours hazy pale yellow/gold with a small white head. Aroma of citrus fruits, some spring floral notes, and fresh cut wood. Flavour is very similar but a little more muted. Citrus stands out as the main quality, but is also quite buttery on the tongue. A bland style made palatable.

Excellently sessionable; clean, friendly and forward.  Aroma of tropical hops and biscuit malts; lots of meadowy hops; wildflowers, grasses.  Crisp flavor with mildly present hops and well balanced doughy pale malts; as light and substantial in body as something of solid texture can be.  Intriguing; in a favorable way, not surprising.

750mL growler, sent from Glouglouburp (thanks a lot, Dany). Pours a cloudy blonde with a medium white head - good retention. Nose is absolutely stunning, especially considering the low ABV, bursting of piney hop goodness, floral notes, and buttery biscuity malt to back. Flavour is less intense, but features similar notes of light pine and floral notes, and lots of the biscuity malt backing. Finishes with notes of biscuit, lemon and floral / piney hops - very, very subtle bitterness. Extremely easy to drink and refreshing. Could drink litres of this. Great sessionable ale.

A murky blonde ale with a thin lacing creamy white head. In aroma, beautiful citrusy hops, floral, resinous, mandarine pulp, very nice. In mouth, a smooth fruity biscuit malt with smooth citrus hops, light lemon pulp, very nice. On tap at Reservoir, August 5  2012.
On draft pour.  Great golden color.  Medium to light white head.  Nice well balanced light abv pale ale.  Great biitterness.  Well made.

Pours a hazy pale yellow with a thick and foamy white head...outstanding retention and lacing.  Aroma is citrusy with a mild fresh grassy aroma.  Flavor is wheaty and has lots of fresh grassiness and nice orangey citrus.  Mouthfeel is light/medium with a dry grassy/citrus bitter finish.
last growler from my last hill farmstead trip :(. A baby abner. Great hoppy flavors and aromas and such a fast easy drinker. I was extra thristy too.

Draught at the Festival of Farmhouse Ales. Pale orange-yellow. Cloudy, with a low but thick head. Aroma of grapefruit, peach, Simcoe and Amarillo? Biscuity malt and honey. Big peach flavor, some orange, a little grapefruit and grass, and then some sweet bready and biscuity malts. No caramel at all. Would like to have this on tap in my kitchen.
tap at hill farm. pours hazy yellow with good head. great fresh hop aroma. very easy drinking refreshing and hoppy

On tap at Prohibition Pig.  Pours a hazed glowing gold with a medium sized white head.  Crisp musk, light dusty hops.  Hoppy up front, musk, soft wheat.  Soft and gentle, light musk into hops, dusty.  Lovely session beer, could drink this all day.  Gently musk and a light hop bitterness on the finish.
Session ale perfection.  So light and refreshing with great citrus, grass, and dank hop flavor that doesnt result in much bitterness.  Very lightly malty and drinkable as all get up!

Tap and growler.   Awesome big super juicy hop aroma of pineapple,   green grapes,   oranges.   Very fresh tasting.  Taste is crisp refr eshing pineapple,  melon,  toast.      Closest thing to gumball head ive ever tasted, but a bit juicier, more complex than gummed ball head.    Just about the perfect session beer.   Could go for the a few kegs of this bad boy.   A little to good to be sure.  Good candidate for a "desert island" beer.

Enjoyed via a 750ML growler filled 2 days ago at the brewery. ItÂ’s been in the fridge since then and is being enjoyed in a Duvel Tulip.

A - Poured a hazy straw gold color. 1 Finger creamy head with big and small bubbles. Really nice head lacing was present and the bubbles faded slowly. 

S - Lots of big chewy simcoe scent. Pine cones and sap were dominating with some hint of lemon juice and cloves.

T - Very light start to this beer with a hint of light malts that covers the tongue followed by a solid pine resin bitterness and some sugary sweet honey. 

M - 80% carbonation on the mouth swish. Medium body.

O - This is a very sessionable beer. ItÂ’s light, bright, hoppy and easy to drink. A perfect summer time session ale. Great job Shawn and John!

On tap at 2012 Hill Farmstead Festival of Farmhouse Ales. After an onslaught of Saisons the metal band fired up and the hoppy beers came out. This dank-nosed juicy C-hop piece quenched my thirst and desire for hops. Fat, sticky resin nose followed by a dry, light and balanced body with green hoppiness and a nip of minerals. Clean, delectable and forward.

On tap at the Otey abode. Pours a cloudy straw color with moderate frothy white head. Nose holds stunning notes of of pineapple and mango tropical fruits as well as citrus sweetness and touches of spruce and dank earthy loam. Flavor adds lemongrass and white grapefruit to broaden the fruit melange. A nice bitter finish but delectably drinkable. So amazingly flavorful for 4 percent. An incredible collaboration brew.

2L Growler. Pale hazy yellow, decent head that recedes quickly. Aroma of oranges, citrus peel, resinous hops and white flowers. Very aromatic. High lemon tartness blends wonderfully with leafy hops and citruz zest bitterness. Light bodied and dry finish makes it highly drinkable. I really like the actual summer beer trend. It reminds me of DDC Wallonade or TDD Traction ale with Hill Farmstead quality standards. This is a great preamble to the very promising low abv, high citrus series.

32oz growler, fresh, from a good friend.  thank you... pours a semi-hazy, wheat beer like pale yellow brown hue, consistent throughout, and topped with a ore than adequate fluffy frothy white head that eventually reduces down to a milky film.... firm grapefruit and citrus focused nose.  a fair bit juicy to boot which enhances the aroma more ... flavors are not absurdly hop dominated, held in check, but still a very integral factor into the entire equation.  crisp with lemon citrusy zest and a biscuity malt and pale grain backing.  both work well in harmony with each other.  quite a bit a flavor packed into such a small brew with 40 ibus overall.  lighter bodied, refreshing hoppy goodness without being overdone and perfectly quenching.  a touch of bitterness on the backend to provide an additional aspect while offering a touch of dryness to boot...really hoping the small session beer movement continues to see its deserved attention.  i would love to have this at my disposal throughout the year, and not only during the summer months.  an anytime type of brew.  well crafted and executed.

On tap at Prohibition Pig and a sample at the Vermont Beer Festival. Pale yellow with generous white head. Mild grains, lemon and some mixed citrus, light malt, some herbs. High carbonation, mild but flavourful body, little sour but more bitter, becomes sweet on the finish, also quite dry with a nice hit of lemon zest and rosemary. Very easy to drink.

This is probably the best beer IÂ’ve ever had thatÂ’s this low in alcohol. Pours cloudy yellow with good lacing. Smells like hay and dirty farm hops. A little bit bitter, a little grassy. Very full palate. On tap at Farmhouse Tap and Grill.

Thanks to yourefragile for sharing the growler.  Served in Hill Farmstead stemware.  Pours a very pale straw color with a really nice white head and plenty of lacing.  Nose has nice lemon and a touch of citrus. Intense. Flavor more subdued. Light grain. Fairly bitter and quite dry.  Really drinkable.

On tab from keg purchased at Hill Farmstead. Pours a hazy golden color with a small white head. Floral and citrus aroma. Crisp taste with a hoppy middle and malty finish. Great session beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

pours a light golden straw color with a fluffy head that leaves lacing as it falls. blast of hops a first but delicate and herbally sweet smell. soft maltiness and clean mellow yeast esters. taste has a blast of hops but the flavor is delicate mild herbally sweet hops and a gentle bready malt. a perfectly balanced beer it seems. dry bitter with a touch of sweetness. no alcohol detected except after i finished the growler. o__O

On tap at my house. Hazy golden-straw in appearance with a robust long lasting white frothy head. The aroma holds a variety of hop facets, each of which plays very nicely with the others. Dank piney herbals lead to juicy nectar fruit and vibrant tropical fruit. Very fresh and bright, capturing the individual hop character of each respective variety, while simultaneously providing a union that is more delicious than the constitutive parts. The body of the beer is quite full given the abv, even to the point of drinking like a light bodied ipa. There are literally no major flavors to obstruct the hops, which is amazing if youÂ’re into that sort of thing. Caressing pillowy carbonation provides excellent texture, while the finish remains very dry and crisp. With all the super extreme styles being brewed these days, this provides an amazingly welcoming experience. I wish more brewers undertook refinement of low alcohol beer, as it truly is among the most difficult style to do exquisitely well. HatÂ’s off to this collaboration, for it certainly accomplishes that goal.

Resin and citrus aromas aplenty.
Minimal head, hazy straw color.
Thin body with medium carbonation.
Smells like hops, tastes like hops.Backed by light maltiness.
Overall a super hoppy pale ale that is super refreshing and easy to drink(for a hophead).
Great beer.
